item.name: OpenVPN service is running
item.description: OLD KEY: net.udp.listen[1194] - Key was replaced because command "netstat" still shows the port as LISTEN even if closed in firewall rules. Using process method instead (custom, inside zabbix_agent.conf), which monitors the openvpn daemon.

item.name: IPSec service is running
item.description: OLD KEY: net.udp.listen[1194] - Key was replaced because command "netstat" still shows the port as LISTEN even if closed in firewall rules. Using process method instead (custom, inside zabbix_agent.conf), which monitors the openvpn daemon.

item.name: Contents of config.boot
item.description: Zabbix cut the results if the returned information is too large, hence we disabled this item.

item.name: Ping IP
item.params: if fping -u 8.8.8.8 >& /dev/null ;then echo 0; else echo 2; fi

item.name: VRRP process status
item.params: if pgrep keepalived > /dev/null; then echo 1; else echo 0; fi

item.name: VRRP last transition (bond0)
VRRP status (bond0)

discovery_rule.name: GRE discovery
discovery_rule.params: #!/bin/vbash tunnels=`/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show interfaces tunnel|grep 'tun'|awk '{print $1}'` first=1 echo "{" echo "\"data\":[" for tunnel in $tunnels do if [[ $first = 0 ]] ; then echo "," ; fi first=0 peer=`/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show interfaces tunnel $tunnel |grep peer|awk '{ print $4 }'` echo " {\"{#TUN_INT}\":\"$tunnel\",\"{#GRE_PEER}\":\"$peer\"}" done echo "]" echo "}"

item_prototype.name: GRE {#TUN_INT} Peer Status
item_prototype.params: peer=`/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show interfaces tunnel {#TUN_INT} |grep peer|awk '{ print $4 }'`;if fping -u $peer >& /dev/null ;then echo 1; else echo 0; fi

item_prototype.name: GRE {#TUN_INT} Peer Latency
item_prototype.params: peer=`/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show interfaces tunnel {#TUN_INT} |grep peer|awk '{ print $4 }'`;if fping -u $peer >& /dev/null ;then fping -e $peer|awk '{print substr($4,2); }'; else echo 0; fi

trigger_prototype.name: GRE peer {#GRE_PEER} is unreachable
trigger_prototype.description: GRE peer is not responding to ICMP (last 5 verifications)

trigger_prototype.name: GRE peer {#GRE_PEER} latency too high
trigger_prototype.description: GRE peer have latency > 50ms in the last 5 verifications

discovery_rule.name: VPN discovery
discovery_rule.params: #!/bin/vbash peers=`/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show vpn ipsec sa detail |grep 'Peer IP'|awk '{print $3}'` first=1 echo "{" echo "\"data\":[" for peer in $peers do tunnels=`/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show vpn ipsec sa peer $peer |head -n -2| grep ' up\| down'|awk '{print $1}'` for tunnel in $tunnels do if [[ $first = 0 ]] ; then echo "," ; fi first=0 echo " {\"{#VPN_PEER}\":\"$peer\",\"{#VPN_TUNNEL}\":\"$tunnel\"}" done done echo "]" echo "}"

item_prototype.name: VPN peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNELS} - total bytes IN
item_prototype.params: result=`/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show vpn ipsec sa statistics peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} |tail -n 4|grep in|awk '{print $5}'`;if [ "$result" == "n/a" ] ;then echo 0; else echo $result; fi

item_prototype.name: VPN peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} - total bytes OUT
item_prototype.params: result=`/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show vpn ipsec sa statistics peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} |tail -n 4|grep out|awk '{print $5}'`;if [ "$result" == "n/a" ] ;then echo 0; else echo $result; fi

item_prototype.name: VPN peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} status
item_prototype.params: TUNSTATUS="$(/opt/vyatta/bin/vyatta-op-cmd-wrapper show vpn ipsec sa peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} |tail -n 3|head -n 1|awk '{ print $2 }')" && if [ "$TUNSTATUS" == "up" ]; then echo 1; else echo 0; fi

trigger_prototype.name: VPN Peer {#VPN_PEER} Tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} is down (last 5 status)

graph_prototype.name: VPN peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} - data exchanged (resets upon IKE renegotiaton)
VPN peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} - tunnel status (up/down history)

resource.name: Memory use ratio by vyatta processes Bar graph
Memory use ratio by vyatta processes Pie chart

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta - SSH:process_status[pluto].last(#2)}=1 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta - SSH:process_status[pluto].last(#1)}=0
trigger.name: IPSec service is down on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Will trigger only when LAST value is 0 (not running) AND the value before was 1 (running)

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta - SSH:net.udp.listen[1701].last(#2)}=1 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta - SSH:net.udp.listen[1701].last(#1)}=0
trigger.name: L2TP VPN service is down
trigger.description: Will trigger only when LAST value is 0 (not running) AND the value before was 1 (running)

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta - SSH:process_status[openvpn].last(#2)}=1 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta - SSH:process_status[openvpn].last(#1)}=0
trigger.name: OpenVPN service is down on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Will trigger only when LAST value is 0 (not running) AND the value before was 1 (running)

trigger.name: UDP NTP service is down on {HOST.NAME}
